messages.content: organize our docs into an obsidian vault structure. Keep the main project readme at the root, but move all documentation into a more organized structure. Advise on how to proceed.

metadata.context: Documentation organization into Obsidian vault request

messages.content: Successfully created comprehensive Obsidian vault structure with 7 organized sections, moved 20+ markdown files into logical categories, created navigation system with cross-references, and established templates for future documentation. Main README remains at project root as requested.

keyAchievements: ✅ Moved 20+ scattered markdown files into logical categories
✅ Created comprehensive index and overview files
✅ Built templates for consistent future documentation
✅ Configured Obsidian vault settings and plugins
✅ Preserved main README.md at project root

vaultStructure.01-Project-Overview: Project goals, quick start, getting started
vaultStructure.03-Development-Guide: Setup, coding standards, testing, CSS guides
vaultStructure.04-Features: Flash experiments, music integration, Instagram feed
vaultStructure.05-API-Integration: Last.fm API, Instagram Graph API, backend services

nextSteps: Open vault in Obsidian for enhanced navigation
Use templates for new feature documentation

projectStatus.filesMigrated: ✅ Complete - All 20+ files organized and moved
projectStatus.templates: ✅ Complete - Feature and API documentation templates

technicalContext.vaultSoftware: Obsidian with markdown files and cross-references
technicalContext.navigation: Bidirectional links with overview files for each section
technicalContext.templates: Standardized formats for features and API integrations
